name: Beatles - A Day in the Life Quiz | Lyrics by The Beatles | 10 Questions

questions.text:
Which word is missing from the album's opening track?
"It was ______ years ago today
Sgt. Pepper taught the band to play"
questions.explanation:
twenty.

	"Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band" is both the opening and title track of the album. The Beatles started out on "Sgt Pepper" as a concept album, the inspiration of Paul McCartney, although the concept idea was dropped after a couple of the tracks had been recorded. Instead they let their creativity flow and put together a collection of tracks of varied and imaginative musical styles... and thus a musical masterpiece was created.

questions.text:
"What would you think if I sang out of ______ 
Would you stand up and walk out on me"
Complete this lyric from  "With A Little Help From My Friends".
questions.explanation:
tune.

	Ringo Starr took the lead vocal on "With A Little Help From My Friends". The Beatles were in the studio recording "Sgt. Pepper" through the winter of 1966 and into the spring of 1967.

questions.text:
"Picture yourself in a boat on a river 
With tangerine trees and ______ skies"
What type of sky were the Beatles singing about?
questions.explanation:
marmalade.

	These lyrics are from track three "Lucy In The Sky With Diamonds".One of the most memorable track on the album "Lucy" was written by John Lennon and Paul McCartney.

questions.text:
"It's getting better all the time 
I used to get ______ at my school 
The teachers that taught me weren't cool"
So what happened at school?
questions.explanation:
mad.

	"Getting Better" is track four on the album.  "Sgt Pepper" was the first L.P. released in a gatefold sleeve, this opened like a book. The stunning sleeve artwork was designed by Peter Blake.

questions.text:
"I'm fixing a hole where the rain gets in 
And stops my ______ from wandering 
Where it will go"
Which word completes this lyric?
questions.explanation:
mind.

	These lyrics come from "Fixing A Hole". The "Sgt Pepper" album was released with the tracks fading one into the next with no track banding.

questions.text:
"______ morning at five o'clock 
As the day begins 
Silently closing her bedroom door"
On which day of the week was she leaving home?
questions.explanation:
Wednesday.

	The Lennon/McCartney composition "She's Leaving Home" is track six on the album. Paul met Linda Eastman at the launch party for the "Sgt Pepper's" album, while he was still in a relationship with actress Jane Asher. Paul and Linda married in London in March 1969.

questions.text:
"For the benefit of Mr. Kite 
There will be a show tonight on ______"
Which word completes this lyric?
questions.explanation:
trampoline.

	John Lennon drew the inspiration for the lyrics to this song from an antique circus poster. "Being For The Benefit Of Mr Kite!" is track seven on the album.

questions.text:
"If I'd been out till quarter to three 
Would you ______ the door 
Will you still need me, will you still feed me" 
So, what does she do to the door?
questions.explanation:
lock.

	These are words from "When I'm Sixty-Four". This novelty song features a clarinet ensemble. The images of the Beatles on the "Sgt Pepper" sleeve are wax dummies, supplied by Madame Tussauds.

questions.text:
"Standing by a parking meter
When I caught a glimpse of ______ 
Filling in a ticket in her little white book."
Which lovely lady's name is missing from this lyric?
questions.explanation:
Rita.

	Lyrics come from track ten "Lovely Rita". "Sgt Pepper" was the first album to have the song lyrics printed on the album sleeve.

questions.text:
"And though the holes were rather small 
They had to count them all 
Now they know how many holes it takes to fill the ______ Hall 
I'd love to turn you on"
questions.explanation:
Albert.

	"Day In The Life" is the final track on "Sgt Pepper", it ends with a striking forty-second piano chord. On the run-out groove of the album the Beatles played a tape loop of random edits that were played backwards. This has been the source of many an urban myth, although the Beatles have always said it contained no hidden message or meaning. "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band" was recorded at E.M.I 's Abbey Road Studios,  Producer by George Martin  and released in the UK on the 1st June 1967.
